com.blukii.sdk.info

Class ResolveSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blukii.sdk.info.ResolveSettings

  • public final class ResolveSettings
extends java.lang.Object

    Property set of settings to configure the resolving process of data from blukii Info Manager (https://manager.blukiiinfo.com).



    You can access the ResolveSettings by calling BlukiiClient.getResolveSettings().

    Every settings value is writable and has a default value that is used if not changed by the developer.

    With the exception of getLanguagePriority() and getAppLabel() the ResolveSettings properties are only affecting the discovery process that is started by BlukiiClient.initDiscovery(BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener).

    For the single resolving process that is started by BlukiiClient.resolveInputElement(InputElement, BlukiiClient.OnResolveInputElementListener) only getLanguagePriority() and getAppLabel() are relevant.
    See Also:
    BlukiiClient.getResolveSettings(), ResolveData, OutputElement.getResolveState(), BlukiiClient.initDiscovery(BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener), BlukiiClient.resolveInputElement(InputElement, BlukiiClient.OnResolveInputElementListener)

    • Method Detail

      • getAppLabel

        public java.lang.String getAppLabel()
        Gets the app label name that defines the blukii Info App white label Note: the app label has to be also defined on the blukii Info Manager (https://manager.blukiiinfo.com).
        Returns:
        app label key, default is "blukii"
        See Also:
        setAppLabel(String)

      • getCacheTimeout

        public int getCacheTimeout()
        Gets the timeout for the resolver cache.

        You can use this feature to minimize network traffic by caching resolved values. If ResolveData is found for one blukii number the next network request will be done again only after cache timeout.

        You have to consider the following application states to define when caching should be enabled:
        • isCacheEnabledOnForeground(): App is in foreground
        • isCacheEnabledOnBackground(): App is in background
        • isCacheEnabledOnScreenOff(): Device screen is off or locked
        Returns:
        cache timeout in milliseconds, default is CACHETIMEOUT_DEFAULT
        See Also:
        setCacheTimeout(int), CACHETIMEOUT_DEFAULT, isCacheEnabledOnForeground(), isCacheEnabledOnBackground(), isCacheEnabledOnScreenOff()

      • getLanguagePriority

        public java.lang.String[] getLanguagePriority()
        Gets the language priority that is relevant for the selection of the language specific ResolveData fields like url and title.
        Returns:
        list of language ids, default is LANGUAGEPRIORITY_DEFAULT
        See Also:
        setLanguagePriority(String[]), LANGUAGEPRIORITY_DEFAULT, OUTPUTLANGUAGE_ENGLISH, OUTPUTLANGUAGE_FRENCH, OUTPUTLANGUAGE_GERMAN, ResolveData, ResolveData.getLanguage()

      • setCacheTimeout

        public void setCacheTimeout(int cacheTimeout)
        Gets the timeout for the resolver cache.

        For minimizing network traffic, resolved values are cached. If ResolveData is found for one blukii number the next network request will be done again only after cache timeout.

        You can adjust for with application states the cache should be enabled:
        • isCacheEnabledOnForeground(): App is in foreground
        • isCacheEnabledOnBackground(): App is in background
        • isCacheEnabledOnScreenOff(): Device screen is off or locked
        Parameters:
        cacheTimeout - cache timeout in milliseconds, default is CACHETIMEOUT_DEFAULT
        See Also:
        getCacheTimeout(), CACHETIMEOUT_DEFAULT, isCacheEnabledOnForeground(), isCacheEnabledOnBackground(), isCacheEnabledOnScreenOff()

      • setLanguagePriority

        public void setLanguagePriority(java.lang.String[] localeIds)
        Sets the language priority that is relevant for the selection of the language specific ResolveData fields like url and title.
        Parameters:
        localeIds - list of language ids
        See Also:
